跑.definition: to run; to run away; to escape; to run around (on errands etc); (of a gas or liquid) to leak or evaporate; (verb complement) away; off

跑了和尚跑不了廟.pinyin: pao3 le5 he2 shang4 pao3 bu4 liao3 miao4
跑了和尚跑不了廟.definition: the monk can run away, but the temple won't run with him (idiom); you can run this time, but you'll have to come back; I'll get you sooner or later; also written 跑得了和尚，跑不了廟|跑得了和尚，跑不了庙[pao3 de2 liao3 he2 shang4 , pao3 bu4 liao3 miao4]

跑了和尚，跑不了寺.pinyin: pao3 le5 he2 shang4 , pao3 bu4 liao3 si4
跑了和尚，跑不了寺.definition: the monk can run away, but the temple won't run with him (idiom); you can run this time, but you'll have to come back; I'll get you sooner or later

跑分.definition: (computing) to benchmark a computer, phone, CPU etc; (benchmark test) score; (sports) run (scoring unit in cricket); to provide a channel for the transfer of illegally obtained funds (in return for a commission)

跑咖.definition: (Tw) (neologism) to go to a coffee shop

跑官.definition: to seek a government post through bribery or connections

跑得了和尚，跑不了廟.pinyin: pao3 de2 liao3 he2 shang4 , pao3 bu4 liao3 miao4
跑得了和尚，跑不了廟.definition: the monk can run away, but the temple won't run with him (idiom); you can run this time, but you'll have to come back; I'll get you sooner or later

跑掉.definition: to run away; to take to one's heels

跑業務.definition: (of a salesperson) to visit potential customers with the aim of selling products or services

跑步.definition: to run; to jog; (military) to march at the double

跑江湖.definition: to make a living as a traveling performer etc

跑票.definition: to vote against the party line; to vote contrary to one's promise

跑腿子.definition: (dialect) to live as a bachelor; bachelor

跑調.definition: to be off-key or out of tune (while singing) (colloquial)

跑走.definition: to escape; to flee; to run away

跑跑顛顛.definition: to work hectically; to be on the go; to run around attending to various tasks

跑路.definition: to travel on foot; (informal) to run off; to abscond

跑車.definition: racing bicycle; racing car; sports car; to drive a vehicle (such as a truck or taxi) for a living; (of a conductor or attendant) to work on a train; (mining) (of a cable-car) to slip away (in an accident)

跑遍.definition: to go everywhere; to scour (the whole town)

跑題.definition: to digress; to stray from the topic

跑馬.definition: horse race; to ride a horse at a fast pace; (dialect) wet dream

跑馬圈地.definition: rushing to stake one's claim in new markets (idiom)

跑馬山.definition: Paoma Mountain in Kangding 康定[Kang1 ding4], Sichuan

跑馬燈.definition: lantern with a carousel of paper horses rotating under convection, used at Lantern Festival 元宵節|元宵节[Yuan2 xiao1 jie2]; chaser lights; self-scrolling horizontal text display, such as a news ticker
